Event.0: After having served as chancellor of the Exchequer (1997–2007), British Labour Party politician Gordon Brown became prime minister of the United Kingdom.
Event.1: Former Playboy playmate and Baywatch actress Donna D'Errico (38) divorces Motley Crue bassist Nikki Sixx (48) due to irreconcilable differences after 9 years of marriage
Event.2: Aerosmith become first major band to let fans download a full new track free from the internet
Event.3: Djibouti gained its independence from France.
Event.4:
J.J. Abrams
American writer, director, and producer
was born
Event.5: Broadway musical actress-singer Ethel Merman (56) weds academy award-winning actor Ernest Borgnine (47) in Beverly Hills, California
Event.6: 1st atomic power station opens - Obninsk, near Moscow in Russia
Event.7: North Korean troops reach Seoul, UN asks members to aid South Korea, Harry Truman orders US Air Force & Navy into Korean conflict
Event.8: Inventor Jack Kilby (24) weds Barbara Annegers
Event.9:
Ross Perot
American businessman
was born
Event.10: American businessman and philanthropist Ross Perot, who was an independent candidate for U.S. president in 1992 and 1996, was born.
Event.11: 1st color TV demo, performed by Bell Laboratories in NYC
Event.12:
Bob Keeshan
American television producer and entertainer
was born
Event.13: During World War I, Greece declared war on the Central Powers.
Event.14: George Dixon becomes 1st black boxing champ (Bantam weight)
Event.15:
Helen Keller
American author and educator
was born
Event.16:
Yen made official monetary unit of Japan
First minted in 1869, the yen was adopted as Japan's official monetary unit this day in 1871, when the government suspended the exchange of clan notes, money issued by feudal lords that had circulated since the 16th century.
Event.17:
Emma Goldman
American anarchist
was born
Event.18: During the first Battle of Cold Harbor in the American Civil War, Confederate General Robert E. Lee attacked Union troops, driving them back in disorder and forcing them to withdraw to the south side of the Chickahominy River.
Event.19: Charles Stewart Parnell, Irish nationalist and leader in the struggle for Irish Home Rule, was born in Avondale, County Wicklow.
Event.20: Joseph Smith, founder of the Mormon church, was murdered by an armed mob in Carthage, Illinois.
Event.21: British historian Edward Gibbon completed The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire.
Event.22: War of the Austrian Succession: Battle of Dettingen: in Bavaria, King George II of Britain personally leads troops into battle. The last time a British monarch commanded troops in the field.
Event.24: Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo sets sail from the Mexican port of Navidad to explore the west coast of North America on behalf of the Spanish Empire
Event.25: Earl Henry III of Nassau weds Mencia de Medoza, 16-years old marquess
